page.title: 01WILBERLEE AND SLAITHWAITE.
page.content: The block is situated in the south -west of Kirklees and occupies a strategic position between Yorkshire and Lancashire. From the centre of the Colne Valley town of Slaithwaite the area stretches west towards the Pennine ranges rising steadily to 1200 feet above sea-level.It includes Scammonden, a once-remote valley, now dominated by the reservoir and the busy M62 motorway which crosses the northern boundary.Towering above the surrounding landscape are the twin masts of the Moorside Edge radio transmitter. This predominantly rural area consists mainly of grassland pastures which support dairy and beef herds.Most of the population live in the HillTop district of Slaithwaite while the remainder live in hillside property or small hamlets like{Wilberlee.}
